005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tInstances;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
011import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
012import edu.wpi.first.networktables.IntegerArrayEntry;
013import edu.wpi.first.networktables.IntegerArrayPublisher;
014import edu.wpi.first.networktables.IntegerArrayTopic;
015import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NTSendable;
016import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NTSendableBuilder;
017import edu.wpi.first.networktables.StringArrayPublisher;
018import edu.wpi.first.networktables.StringArrayTopic;
019import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableRegistry;
020import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
021import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase;
022import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotState;
023import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot;
024import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Watchdog;
025import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
026import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.livewindow.LiveWindow;
027import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command.InterruptionBehavior;
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.Collections;
030import java.util.Iterator;
031import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
032import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
033import java.util.List;
034import java.util.Map;
035import java.util.Set;
036import java.util.function.Consumer;
037
038/**
039 * The scheduler responsible for running {@link Command}s. A Command-based robot should call {@link
040 * CommandScheduler#run()} on the singleton instance in its periodic block in order to run commands
041 * synchronously from the main loop. Subsystems should be registered with the scheduler using {@link
042 * CommandScheduler#registerSubsystem(Subsystem...)} in order for their {@link Subsystem#periodic()}
043 * methods to be called and for their default commands to be scheduled.
044 *
045 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
046 */
047public final class CommandScheduler implements NTSendable, AutoCloseable {
048  /** The Singleton Instance. */
049  private static CommandScheduler instance;
050
051  /**
052   * Returns the Scheduler instance.
053   *
054   * @return the instance
055   */
056  public static synchronized CommandScheduler getInstance() {
057    if (instance == null) {
058      instance = new CommandScheduler();
059    }
060    return instance;
061  }
062
063  // A set of the currently-running commands.
064  private final Set<Command> m_scheduledCommands = new LinkedHashSet<>();
065
066  // A map from required subsystems to their requiring commands. Also used as a set of the
067  // currently-required subsystems.
068  private final Map<Subsystem, Command> m_requirements = new LinkedHashMap<>();
069
070  // A map from subsystems registered with the scheduler to their default commands.  Also used
071  // as a list of currently-registered subsystems.
072  private final Map<Subsystem, Command> m_subsystems = new LinkedHashMap<>();
073
074  private final EventLoop m_defaultButtonLoop = new EventLoop();
075  // The set of currently-registered buttons that will be polled every iteration.
076  private EventLoop m_activeButtonLoop = m_defaultButtonLoop;
077
078  private boolean m_disabled;
079
080  // Lists of user-supplied actions to be executed on scheduling events for every command.
081  private final List<Consumer<Command>> m_initActions = new ArrayList<>();
082  private final List<Consumer<Command>> m_executeActions = new ArrayList<>();
083  private final List<Consumer<Command>> m_interruptActions = new ArrayList<>();
084  private final List<Consumer<Command>> m_finishActions = new ArrayList<>();
085
086  // Flag and queues for avoiding ConcurrentModificationException if commands are
087  // scheduled/canceled during run
088  private boolean m_inRunLoop;
089  private final Set<Command> m_toSchedule = new LinkedHashSet<>();
090  private final List<Command> m_toCancel = new ArrayList<>();
091
092  private final Watchdog m_watchdog = new Watchdog(TimedRobot.kDefaultPeriod, () -> {});
093
094  CommandScheduler() {
095    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_Command, tInstances.kCommand2_Scheduler);
096    SendableRegistry.addLW(this, "Scheduler");
097    LiveWindow.setEnabledListener(
098        () -> {
099          disable();
100          cancelAll();
101        });
102    LiveWindow.setDisabledListener(
103        () -> {
104          enable();
105        });
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Changes the period of the loop overrun watchdog. This should be kept in sync with the
110   * TimedRobot period.
111   *
112   * @param period Period in seconds.
113   */
114  public void setPeriod(double period) {
115    m_watchdog.setTimeout(period);
116  }
117
118  @Override
119  public void close() {
120    SendableRegistry.remove(this);
121    LiveWindow.setEnabledListener(null);
122    LiveWindow.setDisabledListener(null);
123  }
124
125  /**
126   * Get the default button poll.
127   *
128   * @return a reference to the default {@link EventLoop} object polling buttons.
129   */
130  public EventLoop getDefaultButtonLoop() {
131    return m_defaultButtonLoop;
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Get the active button poll.
136   *
137   * @return a reference to the current {@link EventLoop} object polling buttons.
138   */
139  public EventLoop getActiveButtonLoop() {
140    return m_activeButtonLoop;
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Replace the button poll with another one.
145   *
146   * @param loop the new button polling loop object.
147   */
148  public void setActiveButtonLoop(EventLoop loop) {
149    m_activeButtonLoop =
150        requireNonNullParam(loop, "loop", "CommandScheduler" + ".replaceButtonEventLoop");
151  }
152
153  /**
154   * Adds a button binding to the scheduler, which will be polled to schedule commands.
155   *
156   * @param button The button to add
157   * @deprecated Use {@link edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button.Trigger}
158   */
159  @Deprecated(since = "2023")
160  public void addButton(Runnable button) {
161    m_activeButtonLoop.bind(() -> true, requireNonNullParam(button, "button", "addButton"));
162  }
163
164  /**
165   * Removes all button bindings from the scheduler.
166   *
167   * @deprecated call {@link EventLoop#clear()} on {@link #getActiveButtonLoop()} directly instead.
168   */
169  @Deprecated(since = "2023")
170  public void clearButtons() {
171    m_activeButtonLoop.clear();
172  }
173
174  /**
175   * Initializes a given command, adds its requirements to the list, and performs the init actions.
176   *
177   * @param command The command to initialize
178   * @param requirements The command requirements
179   */
180  private void initCommand(Command command, Set<Subsystem> requirements) {
181    m_scheduledCommands.add(command);
182    for (Subsystem requirement : requirements) {
183      m_requirements.put(requirement, command);
184    }
185    command.initialize();
186    for (Consumer<Command> action : m_initActions) {
187      action.accept(command);
188    }
189
190    m_watchdog.addEpoch(command.getName() + ".initialize()");
191  }
192
193  /**
194   * Schedules a command for execution. Does nothing if the command is already scheduled. If a
195   * command's requirements are not available, it will only be started if all the commands currently
196   * using those requirements have been scheduled as interruptible. If this is the case, they will
197   * be interrupted and the command will be scheduled.
198   *
199   * @param command the command to schedule. If null, no-op.
200   */
201  private void schedule(Command command) {
202    if (command == null) {
203      DriverStation.reportWarning("Tried to schedule a null command", true);
204      return;
205    }
206    if (m_inRunLoop) {
207      m_toSchedule.add(command);
208      return;
209    }
210
211    if (CommandGroupBase.getGroupedCommands().contains(command)) {
212      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
213          "A command that is part of a command group cannot be independently scheduled");
214    }
215
216    // Do nothing if the scheduler is disabled, the robot is disabled and the command doesn't
217    // run when disabled, or the command is already scheduled.
218    if (m_disabled
219        || RobotState.isDisabled() && !command.runsWhenDisabled()
220        || isScheduled(command)) {
221      return;
222    }
223
224    Set<Subsystem> requirements = command.getRequirements();
225
226    // Schedule the command if the requirements are not currently in-use.
227    if (Collections.disjoint(m_requirements.keySet(), requirements)) {
228      initCommand(command, requirements);
229    } else {
230      // Else check if the requirements that are in use have all have interruptible commands,
231      // and if so, interrupt those commands and schedule the new command.
232      for (Subsystem requirement : requirements) {
233        Command requiring = requiring(requirement);
234        if (requiring != null
235            && requiring.getInterruptionBehavior() == InterruptionBehavior.kCancelIncoming) {
236          return;
237        }
238      }
239      for (Subsystem requirement : requirements) {
240        Command requiring = requiring(requirement);
241        if (requiring != null) {
242          cancel(requiring);
243        }
244      }
245      initCommand(command, requirements);
246    }
247  }
248
249  /**
250   * Schedules multiple commands for execution. Does nothing for commands already scheduled.
251   *
252   * @param commands the commands to schedule. No-op on null.
253   */
254  public void schedule(Command... commands) {
255    for (Command command : commands) {
256      schedule(command);
257    }
258  }
259
260  /**
261   * Runs a single iteration of the scheduler. The execution occurs in the following order:
262   *
263   * <p>Subsystem periodic methods are called.
264   *
265   * <p>Button bindings are polled, and new commands are scheduled from them.
266   *
267   * <p>Currently-scheduled commands are executed.
268   *
269   * <p>End conditions are checked on currently-scheduled commands, and commands that are finished
270   * have their end methods called and are removed.
271   *
272   * <p>Any subsystems not being used as requirements have their default methods started.
273   */
274  public void run() {
275    if (m_disabled) {
276      return;
277    }
278    m_watchdog.reset();
279
280    // Run the periodic method of all registered subsystems.
281    for (Subsystem subsystem : m_subsystems.keySet()) {
282      subsystem.periodic();
283      if (RobotBase.isSimulation()) {
284        subsystem.simulationPeriodic();
285      }
286      m_watchdog.addEpoch(subsystem.getClass().getSimpleName() + ".periodic()");
287    }
288
289    // Cache the active instance to avoid concurrency problems if setActiveLoop() is called from
290    // inside the button bindings.
291    EventLoop loopCache = m_activeButtonLoop;
292    // Poll buttons for new commands to add.
293    loopCache.poll();
294    m_watchdog.addEpoch("buttons.run()");
295
296    m_inRunLoop = true;
297    // Run scheduled commands, remove finished commands.
298    for (Iterator<Command> iterator = m_scheduledCommands.iterator(); iterator.hasNext(); ) {
299      Command command = iterator.next();
300
301      if (!command.runsWhenDisabled() && RobotState.isDisabled()) {
302        command.end(true);
303        for (Consumer<Command> action : m_interruptActions) {
304          action.accept(command);
305        }
306        m_requirements.keySet().removeAll(command.getRequirements());
307        iterator.remove();
308        m_watchdog.addEpoch(command.getName() + ".end(true)");
309        continue;
310      }
311
312      command.execute();
313      for (Consumer<Command> action : m_executeActions) {
314        action.accept(command);
315      }
316      m_watchdog.addEpoch(command.getName() + ".execute()");
317      if (command.isFinished()) {
318        command.end(false);
319        for (Consumer<Command> action : m_finishActions) {
320          action.accept(command);
321        }
322        iterator.remove();
323
324        m_requirements.keySet().removeAll(command.getRequirements());
325        m_watchdog.addEpoch(command.getName() + ".end(false)");
326      }
327    }
328    m_inRunLoop = false;
329
330    // Schedule/cancel commands from queues populated during loop
331    for (Command command : m_toSchedule) {
332      schedule(command);
333    }
334
335    for (Command command : m_toCancel) {
336      cancel(command);
337    }
338
339    m_toSchedule.clear();
340    m_toCancel.clear();
341
342    // Add default commands for un-required registered subsystems.
343    for (Map.Entry<Subsystem, Command> subsystemCommand : m_subsystems.entrySet()) {
344      if (!m_requirements.containsKey(subsystemCommand.getKey())
345          && subsystemCommand.getValue() != null) {
346        schedule(subsystemCommand.getValue());
347      }
348    }
349
350    m_watchdog.disable();
351    if (m_watchdog.isExpired()) {
352      System.out.println("CommandScheduler loop overrun");
353      m_watchdog.printEpochs();
354    }
355  }
356
357  /**
358   * Registers subsystems with the scheduler. This must be called for the subsystem's periodic block
359   * to run when the scheduler is run, and for the subsystem's default command to be scheduled. It
360   * is recommended to call this from the constructor of your subsystem implementations.
361   *
362   * @param subsystems the subsystem to register
363   */
364  public void registerSubsystem(Subsystem... subsystems) {
365    for (Subsystem subsystem : subsystems) {
366      if (subsystem == null) {
367        DriverStation.reportWarning("Tried to register a null subsystem", true);
368        continue;
369      }
370      m_subsystems.put(subsystem, null);
371    }
372  }
373
374  /**
375   * Un-registers subsystems with the scheduler. The subsystem will no longer have its periodic
376   * block called, and will not have its default command scheduled.
377   *
378   * @param subsystems the subsystem to un-register
379   */
380  public void unregisterSubsystem(Subsystem... subsystems) {
381    m_subsystems.keySet().removeAll(Set.of(subsystems));
382  }
383
384  /**
385   * Sets the default command for a subsystem. Registers that subsystem if it is not already
386   * registered. Default commands will run whenever there is no other command currently scheduled
387   * that requires the subsystem. Default commands should be written to never end (i.e. their {@link
388   * Command#isFinished()} method should return false), as they would simply be re-scheduled if they
389   * do. Default commands must also require their subsystem.
390   *
391   * @param subsystem the subsystem whose default command will be set
392   * @param defaultCommand the default command to associate with the subsystem
393   */
394  public void setDefaultCommand(Subsystem subsystem, Command defaultCommand) {
395    if (subsystem == null) {
396      DriverStation.reportWarning("Tried to set a default command for a null subsystem", true);
397      return;
398    }
399    if (defaultCommand == null) {
400      DriverStation.reportWarning("Tried to set a null default command", true);
401      return;
402    }
403
404    if (!defaultCommand.getRequirements().contains(subsystem)) {
405      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Default commands must require their subsystem!");
406    }
407
408    if (defaultCommand.getInterruptionBehavior() == InterruptionBehavior.kCancelIncoming) {
409      DriverStation.reportWarning(
410          "Registering a non-interruptible default command!\n"
411              + "This will likely prevent any other commands from requiring this subsystem.",
412          true);
413      // Warn, but allow -- there might be a use case for this.
414    }
415
416    m_subsystems.put(subsystem, defaultCommand);
417  }
418
419  /**
420   * Gets the default command associated with this subsystem. Null if this subsystem has no default
421   * command associated with it.
422   *
423   * @param subsystem the subsystem to inquire about
424   * @return the default command associated with the subsystem
425   */
426  public Command getDefaultCommand(Subsystem subsystem) {
427    return m_subsystems.get(subsystem);
428  }
429
430  /**
431   * Cancels commands. The scheduler will only call {@link Command#end(boolean)} method of the
432   * canceled command with {@code true}, indicating they were canceled (as opposed to finishing
433   * normally).
434   *
435   * <p>Commands will be canceled regardless of {@link InterruptionBehavior interruption behavior}.
436   *
437   * @param commands the commands to cancel
438   */
439  public void cancel(Command... commands) {
440    if (m_inRunLoop) {
441      m_toCancel.addAll(List.of(commands));
442      return;
443    }
444
445    for (Command command : commands) {
446      if (command == null) {
447        DriverStation.reportWarning("Tried to cancel a null command", true);
448        continue;
449      }
450      if (!isScheduled(command)) {
451        continue;
452      }
453
454      m_scheduledCommands.remove(command);
455      m_requirements.keySet().removeAll(command.getRequirements());
456      command.end(true);
457      for (Consumer<Command> action : m_interruptActions) {
458        action.accept(command);
459      }
460      m_watchdog.addEpoch(command.getName() + ".end(true)");
461    }
462  }
463
464  /** Cancels all commands that are currently scheduled. */
465  public void cancelAll() {
466    // Copy to array to avoid concurrent modification.
467    cancel(m_scheduledCommands.toArray(new Command[0]));
468  }
469
470  /**
471   * Whether the given commands are running. Note that this only works on commands that are directly
472   * scheduled by the scheduler; it will not work on commands inside of CommandGroups, as the
473   * scheduler does not see them.
474   *
475   * @param commands the command to query
476   * @return whether the command is currently scheduled
477   */
478  public boolean isScheduled(Command... commands) {
479    return m_scheduledCommands.containsAll(Set.of(commands));
480  }
481
482  /**
483   * Returns the command currently requiring a given subsystem. Null if no command is currently
484   * requiring the subsystem
485   *
486   * @param subsystem the subsystem to be inquired about
487   * @return the command currently requiring the subsystem, or null if no command is currently
488   *     scheduled
489   */
490  public Command requiring(Subsystem subsystem) {
491    return m_requirements.get(subsystem);
492  }
493
494  /** Disables the command scheduler. */
495  public void disable() {
496    m_disabled = true;
497  }
498
499  /** Enables the command scheduler. */
500  public void enable() {
501    m_disabled = false;
502  }
503
504  /**
505   * Adds an action to perform on the initialization of any command by the scheduler.
506   *
507   * @param action the action to perform
508   */
509  public void onCommandInitialize(Consumer<Command> action) {
510    m_initActions.add(requireNonNullParam(action, "action", "onCommandInitialize"));
511  }
512
513  /**
514   * Adds an action to perform on the execution of any command by the scheduler.
515   *
516   * @param action the action to perform
517   */
518  public void onCommandExecute(Consumer<Command> action) {
519    m_executeActions.add(requireNonNullParam(action, "action", "onCommandExecute"));
520  }
521
522  /**
523   * Adds an action to perform on the interruption of any command by the scheduler.
524   *
525   * @param action the action to perform
526   */
527  public void onCommandInterrupt(Consumer<Command> action) {
528    m_interruptActions.add(requireNonNullParam(action, "action", "onCommandInterrupt"));
529  }
530
531  /**
532   * Adds an action to perform on the finishing of any command by the scheduler.
533   *
534   * @param action the action to perform
535   */
536  public void onCommandFinish(Consumer<Command> action) {
537    m_finishActions.add(requireNonNullParam(action, "action", "onCommandFinish"));
538  }
539
540  @Override
541  public void initSendable(NTSendableBuilder builder) {
542    builder.setSmartDashboardType("Scheduler");
543    final StringArrayPublisher namesPub = new StringArrayTopic(builder.getTopic("Names")).publish();
544    final IntegerArrayPublisher idsPub = new IntegerArrayTopic(builder.getTopic("Ids")).publish();
545    final IntegerArrayEntry cancelEntry =
546        new IntegerArrayTopic(builder.getTopic("Cancel")).getEntry(new long[] {});
547    builder.addCloseable(namesPub);
548    builder.addCloseable(idsPub);
549    builder.addCloseable(cancelEntry);
550    builder.setUpdateTable(
551        () -> {
552          if (namesPub == null || idsPub == null || cancelEntry == null) {
553            return;
554          }
555
556          Map<Long, Command> ids = new LinkedHashMap<>();
557          List<String> names = new ArrayList<>();
558          long[] ids2 = new long[m_scheduledCommands.size()];
559
560          int i = 0;
561          for (Command command : m_scheduledCommands) {
562            long id = command.hashCode();
563            ids.put(id, command);
564            names.add(command.getName());
565            ids2[i] = id;
566            i++;
567          }
568
569          long[] toCancel = cancelEntry.get();
570          if (toCancel.length > 0) {
571            for (long hash : toCancel) {
572              cancel(ids.get(hash));
573              ids.remove(hash);
574            }
575            cancelEntry.set(new long[] {});
576          }
577
578          namesPub.set(names.toArray(new String[] {}));
579          idsPub.set(ids2);
580        });
581  }
582}
